_header: There is no creator but one
_description: ‘Do Merci bifore thi Judgement’ — eight twelve-line stanzas (ababababbcbc) with this refrain

BLHar1704.Last Lines:
Now Crist put al thy passionBetwyxe vs and thy
                    IugementAmen
BLHar1704.Editions:
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 85-8.

BLAdd31042.First Lines: There es no creatoure bot oneMakere of ilke a creatoure…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …Now Criste putt all thi grete passiounBi twix vs and thi Iugement
BLAdd31042.Note: A songe how Mercy commes bifore þe Iugement. Doo Mercy Bi fore thi Iugement (f. 123ra).
BLAdd31042.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             “Handschrift British Museum Additional 31042.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         132 (1914): 316-27: 321-3.

BLAdd39574.First Lines:
There is no creatour but oonMaker of ech a
                    creature…
BLAdd39574.Last Lines:
…Now Crist putte al [þi] passyounBitwixe us and þi
                    juggement
BLAdd39574.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 65-7.
Day,  Mabel,
                        ed.  
             The Wheatley Manuscript: Middle English Verse and Prose in British
                Museum MS. Additional 39574.
EETS
         o.s. 155 (1921; repr. 1971): 65-7.

Lam853.First Lines:
There is no creature but oonMaker of euery creatureGod a loone
                    & euer more oonAnd þre in oon alway to endure…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Bileeue is oure saluaciounWith keping of þi
                    comaundementGod putte þin holi passiounBitwixe us & þi
                    iugement. Amen
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 18-21.
